page.title: 06NEW ROMNEY OVER SIXTIES
page.content: A GROUP OF CHILDREN IN OUR CLASS WENT TO PRESCOTT HOUSE TO INTERVIEW THE OLD PEOPLE AND ASK THEM ABOUT RECREATION MOST OF THEM SPENT THEIR LEISURE TIME WHEN THEY WERE YOUNG PLAYING IN GARDENS ON SUNNY DAYS. SOMETIMES THEY EXPLORED PLACES AND MADE CAMPS THEY ALSO PLAYED MARBLES AND WHIPS AND TOPS KNOCK AND RUN WAS THEIR FAVOURITE GAME.IT IS NOW CALLED KNOCK DOWN GINGER. WE ASKED THEM IF THEY KNEW ANY GAMES SPECIAL TO THE MARSH BUT NONE OF THEM DID SO AS THEY WERE NEARLY ALL FROM LONDON. WE ASKED THEM WHAT THEY THINK ABOUT RECREATION TODAY AND ONE PERSON SAID THERE WERE LOTS OF CLUBS, THE OVER SIXTY FIVE ON MONDAYS AND THE TUESDAY CLUB WEDNESDAY IS THE WHIST DRIVE AND THURSDAY AND SATURDAY IS BINGO.FRIDAY IS A TEAPARTY.
